org.apache.hadoop.io.file.tfile

Class Chunk.ChunkEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • org.apache.hadoop.io.file.tfile.Chunk.ChunkEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    Chunk

    public static class Chunk.ChunkEncoder
extends OutputStream
    Chunk Encoder. Encoding the output data into a chain of chunks in the following sequences: -len1, byte[len1], -len2, byte[len2], ... len_n, byte[len_n]. Where len1, len2, ..., len_n are the lengths of the data chunks. Non-terminal chunks have their lengths negated. Non-terminal chunks cannot have length 0. All lengths are in the range of 0 to Integer.MAX_VALUE and are encoded in Utils.VInt format.

    • Field Detail

      • out

        private DataOutputStream out
        The data output stream it connects to.

      • buf

        private byte[] buf
        The internal buffer that is only used when we do not know the advertised size.

      • count

        private int count
        The number of valid bytes in the buffer. This value is always in the range 0 through buf.length; elements buf[0] through buf[count-1] contain valid byte data.

      • writeBufData

        private void writeBufData(byte[] data,
                int offset,
                int len)
                   throws IOException
        Write out a chunk that is a concatenation of the internal buffer plus user supplied data. This will never be the last block.
        Parameters:
        data - User supplied data buffer.
        offset - Offset to user data buffer.
        len - User data buffer size.
        Throws:
        IOException
